contentrichtext.text: In [[enzymology]], a '''quinoprotein glucose dehydrogenase''' ({{EC number|1.1.5.2}}) is an [[enzyme]] that [[catalysis|catalyzes]] the [[chemical reaction]] :D-glucose + ubiquinone <math>\rightleftharpoons</math> D-glucono-1,5-lactone + ubiquinol Thus, the two [[substrate (biochemistry)|substrates]] of this enzyme are [[D-glucose]] and [[ubiquinone]], whereas its two [[product (chemistry)|products]] are [[D-glucono-1,5-lactone]] and [[ubiquinol]]. This enzyme belongs to the family of [[oxidoreductase]]s, specifically those acting on the CH-OH group of donor with a quinone or similar compound as acceptor. The systematic name of this enzyme class is '''D-glucose:ubiquinone oxidoreductase'''. Other names in common use include '''D-glucose:(pyrroloquinoline-quinone) 1-oxidoreductase''', '''glucose dehydrogenase (PQQ-dependent)''', '''glucose dehydrogenase (pyrroloquinoline-quinone)''', and '''quinoprotein D-glucose dehydrogenase'''. This enzyme participates in [[pentose phosphate pathway]]. It employs one [[cofactor (biochemistry)|cofactor]], [[PQQ]]. ==References== {{reflist|1}} * {{cite journal | last =Ameyama |first=Minoru | coauthors= Nonobe Masatsugu, Hayashi Masaharu, Shinagawa Emiko, Matsushita Kazunobu, and Adachi Osao | date = 1985 | title = Mode of binding of pyrroloquinoline quinone to apo-glucose dehydrogenase | journal = Agric. Biol. Chem. | volume = 49 | pages = 1227–1231 }} * {{cite journal | author = Duine JA, Frank J, van Zeeland JK | date = 1979 | title = Glucose dehydrogenase from ''Acinetobacter calcoaceticus'': a 'quinoprotein' | journal = FEBS. Lett. | volume = 108 | pages = 443–6 | pmid = 520586 }} * {{cite journal | author = Yamada M, Sumi K, Matsushita K, Adachi O, Yamada Y | date = 1993 | title = Topological analysis of quinoprotein glucose dehydrogenase in Escherichia coli'' and its ubiquinone-binding site | journal = J. Biol. Chem. | volume = 268 | pages = 12812–7 | pmid = 8509415 }} * {{cite journal | author = Dewanti AR, Duine JA | date = 1998 | title = Reconstitution of membrane-integrated quinoprotein glucose dehydrogenase apoenzyme with PQQ and the holoenzyme's mechanism of action | journal = Biochemistry. | volume = 37 | pages = 6810–8 | pmid = 9578566 }} * {{cite journal | author = Oubrie A, Rozeboom HJ, Dijkstra BW | date = 1999 | title = Active-site structure of the soluble quinoprotein glucose dehydrogenase complexed with methylhydrazine: a covalent cofactor-inhibitor complex | journal = Proc. Natl. Acad. Sci. U. S. A. | volume = 96 | pages = 11787–91 | pmid = 10518528 }} * {{cite journal | author = M | date = 2001 | title = C-terminal periplasmic domain of Escherichia coli quinoprotein glucose dehydrogenase transfers electrons to ubiquinone | journal = J. Biol. Chem. | volume = 276 | pages = 48356–61 | pmid = 11604400 }} ==External links== ::''The [[CAS registry number]] for this enzyme class is 81669-60-5.'' {{Enzyme links|EC_number=1.1.5.2|IUBMB_EC_number=1/1/5/2}} ===Gene Ontology (GO) codes=== {{GO code links | GO_code=0008876 | name=quinoprotein glucose dehydrogenase}} {{enzyme-stub}} [[Category:EC 1.1.5]] [[Category:Pyrroloquinoline quinone enzymes]] [[Category:Enzymes of unknown structure]]
